server
Class Server

java.lang.Object
  server.Server

public class Server
extends java.lang.Object

This is the Server of mudtwenty. It handles incoming socket connections on PORT and delegates each client to a separate thread. Server maintains a list of associated clients (which it periodically prunes) to allow messages to be send to each connected client.

Author:
Michael Tremel (mtremel@email.arizona.edu)

private  class Server.ReaperTask
          An extension of TimerTask that periodically prunes finished clients.

Field Detail

SYSTEM_TEXT_COLOR

public static final java.awt.Color SYSTEM_TEXT_COLOR
System messages are associated with a single color when sent to the client. This is a dark green.

logger

private static final java.util.logging.Logger logger
Logging utility, globally addressed in entire program as "mudtwenty". This could be augmented by using a global properties file to localize the error strings.

PORT

private static final int PORT
Port the server will run on this local host. In the future, this could be read from a configuration file.

See Also:

private java.util.List<ServerThread> clients

timer

private java.util.Timer timer
Constructor Detail

Server

public Server()
       throws java.io.IOException
Default constructor for Server. It attempts to establish a ServerSocket on PORT, and will throw an IOException in the case that this is impossible. After, it enters a blocking loop waiting for connections.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - indicates problem starting server, most likely a different service running on the same port
Method Detail

installServerResponses

private void installServerResponses()
Installs a list of acceptable commands and their associated action for each ServerThread to run. This should be edited to register new functionality.

getServerResponse

public ServerResponse getServerResponse(Command input)
Returns a ServerResponse appropriate to a given Command. This is useful for quickly parsing incoming ClientMessages for its appropriate action.

Parameters:
input - selected command
Returns:
input's associated ServerResponse

sendMessageToAllClients

public void sendMessageToAllClients(java.lang.String message)
Sends a message to all clients. This is a convince method for defaulting to the default color.

Parameters:
message - message to be sent to clients

sendMessageToAllClients

public void sendMessageToAllClients(java.lang.String message,
                                    java.awt.Color color)
Sends a message to all clients in a given color.

Parameters:
message - message to be sent to clients
color - color clients will see the message in

acceptClients

private void acceptClients()
Main blocking loop of the Server. Waits for new incoming connections and spawns a new ServerThread to handle that client.

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Main entrance to the Server. This creates a new Server, catching severe exceptions.

Parameters:
args - there are no arguments for Server
